overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students conclude that when one of the two data sets they are comparing is skewed, they should use the median and IQR to compare them. Next, students analyze three situations that each compare two different data sets. In each case, students use a table to compare two data sets and decide which measure of center and spread to use in their comparison.

overview_item_data_items: I can determine which measure of central tendency and spread is most appropriate to describe and compare data sets.
I can compare the standard deviation of data sets.
I can analyze and interpret data graphically and numerically.
When analyzing data, determine whether the data distribution is symmetric or skewed to know what measure of center and measure of spread is appropriate.
The median and IQR are the appropriate measures of center and spread when comparing data sets where at least one distribution is skewed.
A smaller measure of spread, either the IQR or standard deviation, is always preferred depending upon the context.
It is appropriate to use the mean and standard deviation to analyze the center and spread of the data when the distribution of a data set appears symmetric after removing the outliers.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students analyze a situation containing two data sets and their corresponding box-and-whisker plots.
Students recognize that two given data sets are symmetric and analyze the mean and standard deviation to make a recommendation.
Students explore data sets that appear skewed but have a symmetric distribution once they remove the outliers.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Which Game Firstâ€”the Data or the Display?
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students analyze two box-and-whisker plots on the same number line and determine possible values that generate the displays.

overview_item_data_items: If facilitating this lesson without student devices, no additional materials are needed.
To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
